er_text: Honestly one of the best experiences I've had in any of my travels! My bf and I knew that we wanted to go to a Comedy Cellar show on our trip to NYC, and since reservations at the OG location are instantly booked out, I made reservations at the Village Underground. This venue is still an intimate and charming little place, and the show was just perfect. I had made the reservation for Halloween night, and knowing that there's a Halloween parade at the village, we headed out extra early. Our show was at 7:30 and we made it there around 6:50, and since we were a party of two, we were able to get a front row table! We were literally an arms distance from the comics. Of course, you get made fun of when you sit in the front row but that made the whole experience extra fun! You might not know everyone in the lineup, but they are really all so good. The service here is also really top notch. Even though it's such a packed venue, they manage to discretely take your orders without disrupting the show. Not to mention they're all super friendly. Overall it was an amazing experience. I'd definitely come back and I recommend this to anyone in or traveling to NYC!

Had a racist ignorant experience I have been a comedy cellar regular customer for almost 4 years.Today I took my wife and we went to the village. The lady sitting on the desk said we have to wait 7 minutes before she can add us to the "paper" waiting list. After the seven minutes passed, we went to her then she pointed us to a bouncer eating at the bar. I went to him gave him my name at 6:45 and he asked me to come back at 7:30 since am the first on the list. We came back at 7:28 and then he asked us to go out to the curb. He came out looking me in the face and called bunch of people infront of us. He called "kaleb" and when I asked the bouncer said he called me 4 times and I didn't answer U said u called Kaleb and bunch of people walked to you. He said now am the bottom of the list cause I didn't answer. Went back to the girl she said not their problem and if I want I can wait for the next show.I told them they called the wrong name but I guess it doesn't matter cause my name is not a typical name that matches the "club policy"

Came here with some friends for a comedy show after work. Had heard great things from local colleagues, and boy were they right. The comedians were high quality, realtively known names, and diverse in person and comedic style. They interacted with the crowd without being caustic, and the host was quite funny as well.Food was fine, unremarkable (note that there is a 2 item minimum per person, which seems like a lot) The place gets packed, and it can get really snug in there. However, I'd still recommend this place without reservation. Looking forward to bringing some friends back soon.

Came to New York for the second time with my boyfriend and everyone recommended to check out comedy shows, especially at Comedy Cellar. We first made reservations online for the 9:15 pm show, which don't ensure you get a seat. You also don't pay for tickets until the end of the show, so you're just reserving your spots. AND you'll still need to check in and grab your tickets an hour ahead, like 8:15 pm.There was a sister bar next door, which we hung out at for a bit. Once it hit 9 pm, we walked over to the venue and got in. Because we had picked up tickets so early, we were literally seated in the front row, so close you could see every pore and detail of the comedian's face. Too close for comfort and we were crammed in a tight spot with the other folks. But ah, they can't help it. They need to utilize every inch of the space. The waitress was super attentive; she kept coming back to check up on us. The venue seating was pretty uncomfortable, but the jokes were hilarious. I haven't laughed that hard since I saw Kevin Hart at the ComedyFest in San Francisco. I'll definitely come back again to laugh my ass off.

A must for locals and tourists alike. Timeless comedy club with the biggest names around.I've come here more recently for Michael Che's secret shows where the money goes to a specific charity of his choice. My one beef about this place is the two purchase minimum per person. But because you've got to buy something, might as well be their bomb fries and a brew.

Overall I had a meh experience here. The drinks are overpriced even by NYC standards. I went on a Saturday night and I thought the comedians were solid but not great. However this place has a good reputation so it might have just been an off night.

You know why I love comedy shows? Because I like laughing. Like most people, if online dating profiles are to be believed. If you don't like laughing, you have bigger problems than reading this review can help you with. The Village Underground is a solid venue. The ceilings are low, the crowd is usually out for a good time, and the size of it means you can come out with larger groups than you can't get into a lot of venues. Speaking of, you should know walking in that despite the association, it's not the Cellar, so the lineup probably isn't full of the heavy hitters you've heard of. Dave Chappelle probably isn't going to be a last minute addition, so temper your expectations.But that doesn't mean you aren't going to see some great comics. Sure, the lineups can sometimes be a little hit or miss, but this is still NYC, so you're going to catch some seriously hilarious people. And if you really don't like them, you can always just drink until everything is funny.There's a two-drink minimum (standard), so you want to be getting your money's worth anyway. The food is just food. Order some fries to soak up the alcohol, and have some laughs.

Loved this place! We came here last Sunday, what an awesome time, we drank, we laughed it was great. There was an awesome lineup every comedian was hilarious!!! I am so happy I found out about this place, can't wait to come back! The only tips I can give is to make reservations ahead of time and also know that you might be sitting with other people at your table. For example we were a group of 8 and they sat 4 other people at our table.There is a drink and appetizer menu which was nice.

Uncomfortable venue regarding seating arrangement.I've been here before for a charity comedy show. Same this evening.What's up with the female wait staff? On several occasions they kept coming over to our section/table to 1) tell my friend and I we were talking too much (excuse me but we were engaged in the comedy skit 2) berated me for using my phone's flashlight (to see the menu since it was dark) 3) jumped over to my friend when she took her phone out to check for an important email.Really unpleasant experience.Cherry on the sundae---my umbrella was taken (accidentally or not)  from someone who shared our table. This being a torrential rainy night. Lucky me.Summary---very much dislike this venue hence, I am rarely a visitor. And the  comedians aren't even funny.

Absolutely amazing night! The space is super super packed and you will most likely be next to a stranger, but who cares when you have plenty to laugh together. We went on a Saturday without a reservation, put our names down about 30 min before the show started, and managed to get two seats. The line up was great, varied in quality and style of course. When there's a comedian who only tell clean jokes, always a fresh breath of air. We ordered some beers and a cocktail. service was as good as one can expect in such a crowded space. Would love to go back again.

The show was great. Me and the hubby went to see Hassan Minaj during our recent trip to NYC.  I actually really like the space at the village underground more then the actual comedy cellar tbh because it's more spacious and I like the different levels and seating options. The cellar always felt super cramped to me in the past.And cuz the hubby doesn't like being front and center we got a perfect spot in the small balcony portion that was just right for him :)The only thing I would say could have been better was a more clear description of how to actually get to the show space/ where to check in. We arrived about 15 mins early as the email said to do and it was very unclear where to actually go. Since you enter thru the actual bar maybe just make that clear in emails you guys send out. It def wasn't just us either.  It seemed to be atleast 6 different people that were waiting on the street very confused from 7:45 till 8:00 all asking each other what to do.  Eventually we asked the guy at the door to the pussycat and went in thru there.

Like many other reviewers, I came here for a Comedy Cellar show. The show itself was actually quite good (with the exception of one comic whose humor veered into unvarnished racism, which was a little awkward, especially as I'm a member of the ethnic group he was directing his vitriol towards), but the venue is a little lackluster.First of all, thanks to nearly non-existent lighting and bare stone walls, the vibe of this place is less "cool basement" and more "terrifying underground dungeon," so there's that. Second, it's freezing in here! I wound up wearing my coat as a cape to keep myself warm. It's also incredibly cramped between tables, so expect to be bumping into other patrons, and vice versa, when people try to get in and out of their seats.Third, the food is pretty terrible. The friend I was with got mozzarella sticks, and they tasted like cafeteria food. She also wound up with a pretty terrible stomachache shortly after we left the show, so I'm pretty suspicious about the kitchen here.Drinks run a pretty standard $14 for cocktails (nothing exciting here, I'm sad to report; I got a gin and white tea cocktail, which was decent) and around $6 for generic beer and cider.The upshot: come for the comedy, not the eats.P.S. Random observation that doesn't really have a natural place in the body of the review: they're really into old America's Funniest Home Video clips here. A weird mash-up of AFV clips and weird 80s/90s dance videos greeted patrons as we entered and waited for the show to start; kind of odd.

Went out with some friends here who were visiting from out of town. We all had a great time. The comics were hilarious and the venue is huge and well organized. The setup around the stage is laid out well, which makes it easy to order drinks quickly. It's a little pricey, but that's what you can expect from a larger venue like this at a primetime slot. Regardless, I knew where I was taking them and I'd do it again.

Caught the 11:30 show last night. I generally only catch show's at the Comedy Cellar, I'm weirdly loyal. But I'm glad I went last night the venue is much larger and more comfortable that the Cellar. Drinks and food were about the same price and pretty much the same menu. The place is organized and well kept which is a nice being NYC. The show was great, it was good line up. Greer Barnes charged at a patron for throwing ice at him, since the guy didn't know how to take a joke. All and all, I'd go back. But heads up, do not go in there with a stick up your ... learn to take a joke
Just took my girl here in a sixty dollar taxi just for the bouncer to tell me they closed when on the website it say they open. Imagine the disappointment overall

I had a great time here. This was my first comedy club, so I was a little nervous...didn't think it would be funny, etc. I was definitely wrong. I was laughing so much that I was crying. The comedians (all but one) had hilarious material that was executed perfectly. There is a 2 item minimum per person. The menu had snacks, some sandwiches, beer, wine, cocktails, martinis. It's a very small menu, but it was perfect for the venue. (I just had 2 Stellas so I can't comment on food). Service was friendly/fast/efficient.I would definitely recommend this place for a fun night out. If you sit at the small tables right in the front they will add you to their routine, so beware! I look forward to coming back.

I went with a group of friends to watch a comedy show on a Friday night. Fun spot, good service, and hilarious acts. We watched 6 different comedians and they all had different styles - great show. Only down side - we sat in the back and table was perpendicular to the stage so you either strained you neck for 90 minutes or leaned across the table. So not all the seats are great but still a cool spot.

Pros: great comedians! We saw Godfrey here and he was/is amazing. Laughed the whole time, and not at the expense of the audience at all (thoroughly impressed at the lack of heckling!)Seats that swivel around, so everyone can get a good view of the stage .Cons: really chilly in that basement!Seating situation is crummy. It's going to be overcrowded, and you're most likely going to be seated next to strangers. Would still return.

Saw Colin Quinn. Venue is small and intimate. Sat right against the stage but even if you're in the 'back' you're roughly 10ft from the stage. Colin Quinn's show was funny. The opener was a great act as well. Two drink minimum was expected. Unfortunately the bar food prior the show doesn't count towards this as it's not ordered during the show. The food is very basic bar food.

absolute riot .  Went with a group of coworkers on a Sunday night. there is a 2 drink minimum( 2 "items" actually) but good selection of drinks and reasonable prices. The comedians were outstanding. Great mix of crowd work and stand up material. never got disrespectful or insulting toward the crowd just good ribbing.  not much else to say except that I highly recommend the place.

My friends and I have been here a million times, and the Blackout Diaries is the by far the best show we've seen here. Diverse cast, incriminating photos, and free shots - that's a winning recipe for a great night, Comedy Cellar!See you soon!

I came here for a Comedy Cellar show on a Friday night and got there by chance around 25 minutes early. I'm so glad we did, because even with reservations (definitely a must), there was a line outside. By the time we got inside, more than half the seats were filled. There's a two drink minimum so as soon as my table was seated, the waitress came around with drink and food menus. Though the calamari and french fries seemed to be popular choices, my date and I stuck with just drinks. There were 6-7 comedians that did short stand-up stints, some very funny, other's less so, but the crowd seemed to like them all. It's a cool place and seems to attract a mix of regulars and out-of-towners who've heard about it.

Laughed my buns off last night. The comics were all so different and hysterical in their own way. Really enjoyed the emcee. We sat right in the front on one of the couches, but it's a small venue so even if you weren't up front, I'm sure the view would be just as good. We had to wait on standby for tickets, but it was well worth the wait. So much fun!
This place is amazing. I have to say that It is the most entertaining corner for fun and food.

Came here for a Comedy Cellar show on a Saturday night. The comedians were hilarious. There are different comedians every night. I Saw Ardie Fuqua, Sam Morril, Liz Treyger, Jeffrey Ross, etc. The Village Underground was a great venue for this comedy show. Great seats all around. They start check-in 45 minutes before the show, but don't let people in until about 15 minutes before show. I don't like how there is a two item order minimum when there is also a cover charge.*reserve a spot online. Will "sell out".**$20 cover charge, plus 2 item order minimum***make sure your receipt is stamped because that's your ticket out of the place

Great place for stand-up comedy in NYC. You'll get to see a a show with one or a series of comedians. Tickets are available online or at the door if you come half an hour before. The venue is spacious enough that everyone gets a table and service is ongoing during the show. Shows are around two hours.

I take everyone who visits to see this show.  Great stand-up comedy acts that'll having you laughing till you cry.  Reserve tickets online and get there early to ensure you get a decent seat.  You can't reserve specific seats, it's a first come, first served basis (the venue isn't too big but it's hard to see if you're stuck in the back).  You are required to order 2 menu items (it can be anything on the menu from alcoholic drinks, food, or soda/water).  You pay at the end of the show and if you have exact cash then you'll get out of there quicker.  I've been here 4 times already and plan to keep coming back!

This place is how stand up comedy should be enjoyed. The setting is quite dark and intimate, but the seating is surprisingly comfortable. The drinks are good and well priced for Manhattan. There is a 2 item minimum. We had reservations for dinner after the show elsewhere, so we didn't have food. From what I saw at other tables, it seemed good. I can't wait to go back!

A general expansion of the Comedy Cellar, the VU is a great venue to see some of your favorite comics. Though it doesn't have the history of the original cellar, the larger room is welcome for groups or anyone who likes space in general. The lineup is generally the same quality as you would find at the CC, so don't worry about the product being diluted. They have food here, but I would suggest eating before or after your show as most of it comes straight from the fryer (not that there's anything wrong with that). Def get here on the earlier side to get a good table! While you can reserve tickets, you can't reserve seats, so getting in early assures you're not at a strange angle or staring into a strangers mug all eve. Overall, a great spot to spend an eve in the NYC. Do it.

Amazing show.  5 talented professional comedians.   But the seating was so uncomfortable it was worse than a trans pacific flight in coach.   Sitting sideways,  or even facing the same direction as the stage, packed like sardines.  Pretty sure I missed half the jokes cause of the leg pain.

So I was sad to find out the house band wasn't performing on Saturday nights anymore and turned it to a comedy club that night.  I then gave it a try because I heard good things.If you have ever been to VU in the past for the band, it looks EXACTLY the same.....just filled the dance floor with tables.  So here's some tips:- Reservations are important....do it weeks in advance if you want a specific time.  They have different time slots starting from 7:15pm to 12:15am...check out their website.  I came to the 7:15pm showing and I went to the front doors at 6:30pm and they gave me my tickets and asked what area I wanted to be seated at.  It's first come first serve so we chose the front.  We pay everything at the end of the show.  Depending on the time you choose is how much you'll pay for a cover charge...mine was $20pp- There's 2 locations - There is a 2 drink minimum.  If you want munchies the calamari is pretty good.- If you sit in the front, bring a shawl or sweater....the air is pretty much on you and can get a bit nippy.- I had Marina As our host....she was fantastic - 5 comedians....I had 2 faves Greer Barnes and Leonard Outzs - They offer 25% off your food and drinks at the bar next door (The Fat Black Pussycat....gotta love the name) AFTER the show...they give you this offer card before the show begins.It was a great time.  The reason for 4 stars is because I was really cold in the front.  Now that I know I will definitely bring something to keep me warmer.

Though significantly larger and less intimate than the Comedy Cellar, this sister club hosts a pantheon of hilarious talent nightly. While the Cellar is always my first choice, if you can't get a reservation there, walk around the block and enjoy a show at the Village Underground.

Pretty small place. Saw a live Latin artist. I don't remember his name, but he had a song that was popular on the Fast and the Furious movie. Anyway, the tables are dirty, bathroom dirtier and the staff the dirtiest. That was my experience and maybe on other days the tables are cleaned, bathroom's cleaned and staff showered. The drinks however very strong. Hey there is always a plus to a long list of minuses.

I have been here when it serves as a branch of the Comedy Cellar, not as a dance club, so my comments will be confined to that.The nearby Comedy Cellar is one of the elite Manhattan comedy clubs and comics often perform at both clubs the same night. Excellent comics; more comfortable seats then the Cellar; pleasant staff and  reasonable (for clubs) pricing makes this a great choice.

Wow. What an incredible night here. I have to first give a shout out to Liz F. - my experience here couldn't have been better.I'm not sure how this differs from CC, but as you've read they are sister venues. We had a really great view of the stage. In all, about 5-6 comedians came on; expect to spend about two hours here. They tell you to come 15 minutes prior and not any sooner ; it's really not necessary to come early. The food and drinks were perfect for the ambiance and the sangrias - just wow! Ordered a few pitchers for our table. I did think some of the acts were a bit strange... one girl was sick! And she even made jokes about her being germy... well by all means rest and get better, no one wants you to spread your germs. The people sitting in the front are generally going to be the butt of most jokes made. The last act was definitely a comedian that we all recognized (totally blanking on the name, but he's in some bigger comedies) - he was great. I'd absolutely love to come back here, but it's just a tad much for an average night out (I think tickets are ~$20 and then drinks + food, etc). Perhaps when it's a special occasion!

Last night was my first time at village underground and it definitely did not disappoint! I tried getting reservations to comedy cellar two weeks ahead but it was booked up - I definitely recommend buying tickets ahead of time. I signed up for the 9:15pm show because we heard the later you go, the better it gets. We had an amazing show and everyone was cracking up the entire time. Luckily we had surprise guests Judd Apatow and Chris Rock! There was also Michael Che and Pete Holmes. They were all hilarious - even the MC for the night. I am so excited to tell everyone about my experience at The Village Underground and I can't wait to go back! I recommend attending on a Saturday date night.
Went on a Friday night, and it was pretty crowded. The crowd is great. Bartenders are super friendly, servers were awesome! BEST PLACE TO GO!

The only mistake we made was arriving dead last for our reservation time. The forum is cozy with everyone getting a seat and view of the stage.  The wait staff was very attentive to keep you fed and hydrates. The line-up was great with some older and newer comics. Nothing was off limits and all of them were hilarious. Best advice, get there early.  Enjoy

I've been going to the Comedy Cellar since I turned 21 and have always had great experiences there.  Recently I caught a show at their Village Underground outpost and also had a great time.  The room mirrors the Comedy Cellar, including the stained glass plaque on stage.  The comedians were top of the line for the show I saw (Barry Crimmins, Kurt Metzger) which has also been my experience at the Comedy Cellar.  Overall great experience and I recommend getting out to a comedy show a few times a year.

This place holds a special place in my heart.  I used to travel to NYC every weekend and I was one of their regulars here.  So there is the VU and the Comedy Cellar.  Both so awesome.  If you thought you didn't like live music, think again.  The band is awesome.  They sing a wide range of things and you'll see a wide range of people on a Saturday night.  The crowd is so diverse and everyone just wants to have a drink and enjoy some good music.  I haven't been to the Comedy Cellar but people rave about it.  I know Ardie and he is absolutely amazing and hysterical.  I celebrated some birthdays here and they were some of the best.  The staff is great, after coming here a few times they recognized me and we all became friends.  The staff also says its really a family environment between everyone who works there.  LOVE THIS PLACE.

Been awhile since I've been here but from what I remember this place was great. The music and the people gave it a New York City vibe to it like no other place. I came here last week Friday and they had a comedy night which I wasn't interested in. But the bar upstairs was just as I remembered it.

I'm a new fan of the Village Underground. This was my second Sunday evening attending an open mic where great talent hits the stage--and yeah, there are some misses too; but BLESS their little hearts for such tenacity and bThe host, Ron Grant, the hostess, the back-up singers including gospel great Melonie Daniels and band are AWESOMELY talented. They too would intermittently perform between sets. It was quite moving yet entertaining having them "take you to church".The venue is dimly lit and very intimate though a crowd of 200+ can comfortably be seated. There's a $15pp cover charge and table seating comes at a minimum charge of two items off the menu per set during the evening OR you can stand for FREE. It's a good way to spend your Sunday evening as a tourist or a native New Yorker--even if you have to be at work Monday morning at 8AM. Live a little and experience the VU.

Colin Quinn is not funny, and he spent at least 50% of his comedy show referring to his notebook for jokes.  Add to that the lack of vegetarian options on the menu (the only thing available was a vegetable skewer for $2), and it makes this venue easy to forget.  Next time I'll go to a REAL comedy club.

We went to the Village Underground when Comedy Cellar was showing their acts here. Always a fun time to go to a comedy club unless something went really wrong. The wait service in the village underground were super quick in seating and serving us. Drinks and food were reasonably priced, providing an assortment of beer, martinis, and fried bar foods. The acts, although can vary depending on when you go, were great! I'm sure they their homework in ensuring the acts are sufficiently laughable. I would highly recommend making reservations when going as it is more than likely they would be sold out on a weekend night. I saw them have to turn down a number of people who didn't make reservations given the full house. This is definitely a great venue for dates or just a group of friends looking to laugh their faces off at someone else's own emotional expense.

I always have a fabulous time, of course I come with my other good humored friends who love a good laugh.  It also depends on who is the comedian, so it's good to get reviews and post their names on yelp if you do not like one of them so we do not waste our $.  That is what our yelp community is all about :)One star down because the person at the door was a bit rude, but nonetheless we laughed our butt's off the entire time!  Come early if you want a good table because it will get packed.

I wouldve given them five stars, but te seating arrangement was ridiculous. (ill get to that at the end). The performances were jaw-dropping! Some were so entertaining and comical. I even gave one performance a standing ovation - that woman with the violin killed it!!! There were some performances that weren't that great, but nobody sucked. The host was even entertaining, as well as the house band!!Now to the reason why i dropped a star. We made reservations beforehand and was told that we would have a table. What they left out was that there would also be a party of 5 joining our table as well. (it was a total of 8, including us). It was not comfortable at all, because whoeever was at the end of the table had to keep getting up to allow those in the back to use the bathroom. All this annoyance for a $15 cover charge? But honestly, the performances were worth it, and i will be returning in the future, although not the immediate future.

What an unexpected night! The boyfriend and I were looking for something to do during our vacation on a Wednesday night and I stumbled across this on yelp. This is a great hidden gem -- it's located under the Fat Black Pussycat (or whatever it's called.. What a name huh?). The fact that it's underground gives it a cool vibe! Wednesday night was actually perfect -- no cover fee!  There is a "2 drink minimum" per person but our waitress told us that it actually means two items. So I ordered a drink per recommendation of our very helpful & friendly waitress, cheese sticks, and the bf ordered a pineapple martini and chicken kabobs. The drinks were stronger than I expected but that was good because the price for it was not on the cheap side. The food was whatever. Best part of this place is the house band! They are super talented & entertaining!!! Worth every penny dropped that night! 5 stars for the band alone.
Came here on a whim with my friend. It's grungy and gritty but I had SO MUCH FUN! Music was awesome drinks were cheap. I felt like I was 16 again at someone's basements house party. Had a blast.

--Sunday Night "Ron Grant & Friends" Open Mic Review--**In November 2015, after over 16 years, Ron Grant & Friends ended its run at the Village Underground and is looking for a new venue. Like many fans of this weekly mainstay, I can't wait for it to return!**Sunday night at the Village Underground is a legendary experience that transcends race, generation and occupation. Host Ron Grant, a veteran soul singer and talent scout, is an indelible force; his powerful vocals and stirring showmanship is the wind behind this very special evening. Frequent co-hosts Melonie Daniels, Cheryl Pepsi Riley and Kimberly Nichole are also enormous talents in their own right. Celebrity guests frequently take the stage or are spotted in the audience. Folks like Chaka Kahn, Prince and Jamie Foxx have been known to stop by. My mom once sat at a table with Mariah Carey! As Diddy would say, "Take that, take that."As an audience member, all you need is a love for soul music, a lil praise for the Lord and positive vibes to share. But if you're going to take the mic, make sure you've got a voice for the gawds, please; the lineup often totes multi-octave vocalists with impressive stage presence. This is not a place for American Idol rejects (aka the William Hung's of the world...you remember him, the "She Bangs" guy). This is also not a place for studio singers who do not know how to perform and harmonize with a live band.The night usually begins and ends with a riveting number from Ron himself. A bewitching rendition of Marvin Gaye's "I Want You" is one of his staples. Performers come from all over the world, with unique sounds and styles. I've never come here and had a bad experience (and I've been coming here since I was a child). On occasion there might be a lot of gospel singers, and if that's not your genre, I suggest waiting it out. 70-90s R&B, Funk, Quiet Storm and Neo Soul tunes tend to be the crowd pleasers.Details about the show: The show starts around 9:30 p.m. and is usually packed. Typically, a line begins to form outside of the venue around 8:00 p.m. Early arrival is necessary for large groups. Admission is $15 and seating is first come, first served, with the exception of reserved booths in the front. Drinks and bar fare are moderately priced ($7-15). There's usually a performance break around midnight, which allows for some of the audience to leave and seats open up for the late crowd. The show usually ends around 2:00 a.m. Singers sign up to participate in the beginning and play with a live band. The band is just as talented as the singers and one of the most adaptable and in-tune group of musicians I've ever come across. They deserve a bow.My experiences at the Village Underground, and at Ron Grant & Friends, more correctly, is an enduring part of my experience as a native New Yorker and I am thankful for them.

WOW.  My wife and I were in the city for just one night.  Looked through Yelp and saw the reviews and decided to give it a try.We were blown away, they were simply amazing.  Thought Cheryl Pepsi Riley was just a guest with the band but I guess she is part of it and is there all the time.We ended up staying till they finished at 2am (normally we are well asleep by then) It was a Wednesday and wasnt crowded at all.Service was good, didnt order food but drinks were good and for NYC reasonably priced.I would give them 10 stars if I could.  We will make it a point to see them again when in NYC.Show doesnt start till 10pm, web site says 930.  If your looking for good live music and are in NYC on a Wed, Thursday, or Friday this place is a must.

I was visiting NYC for a weekend and did some research about comedy clubs around the area. I am hands down glad I chose this place. Had such a great time and I will for sure come back when I visit! The potato chips were so good! Get them!

Ahh this place is such a gem! Only been here a handful of times bc sadly, I no longer live in NYC. But go go go and check out this awesome place. I love the live music and the down to earth feel it has. The one night we went the band was playing music as if we were in the heart of New Orleans. It was  so nice to have that tipsy buzz going while dancing to such authentic music! They need a place like this in Alaska! So take advantage while living in or visiting NY, you won't be disappointed :)

NOTE: I visited this establishment in 2006.  This review was copied from a travel site I previously blogged for.      I found this dance club online before we left, and it caught my attention because of the type of music they play.  Techno/ House music is very common in clubs in NYC, and it's just not my thing.  I can't dance to it and I certainly can't sing to it.  The Village Underground promised hip hop and some 80's stuff.  Bitchin.  We walk in to a rather dark, kinda smelly club.  Immediately I judge and I want to leave.  We order some drinks and start to loosen up.  I step on the dance floor and it's like a natural reaction- my body just goes with the music.  You may have seen me, and if you have, you know I can't dance.  But I love the energy- I love the bass thumping, I love the pulse of the people around you.  The deejay here was awesome, and really knew how to mix to keep people moving with the tempo.  The setting, once you get past the drab entryway, had Hundreds of miniature, reflective glass domes that cast a warm light on the crowd of party animals.  Make time for this place, you won't be disappointed. Unless you don't like fun.

I've been to the original comedy cellar a few years back and my main issue with it was how tiny it was inside, it was definitely very intimate and classic but I didn't like how cramped it was but the show was top notch and there is always the chance that someone famous might stop by to try out some new jokes or to just do a set, when I went to comedy cellar Chris rock was our special guest, so because of all this I was excited to check out another show here so my friend and I decided to see a show there a few days before NYE but it was all sold out, they had tickets to another venue, village underground which is run by the same people who run comedy cellar so we came here instead and it's just what we would've gotten at comedy cellar except way more spacious! There is still the 2 item minimum but I saw people getting 2 bottled waters so that may be my strategy next time, anyway the show was great as usual and aziz ansari was the special guest trying out some new material, there were maybe 5-6 comedians before him and they were all pretty funny, you get your bill when the show is ending and included is your cover and whatever items you get which needs to be stamped before you can leave, good spot to go to at least once, I know that sometimes there is live musical entertainment here so check the schedule before you go

LOVE.LOVE.LOVE this place! It was amazing.  It made me happy.  It made us dance.  It made us forget about everything except reveling in that very moment. I absolutely loved this place and can't wait to return.We kicked off our visit to NYC at the Village Underground and I'm so glad we did.  This place was AHHHMAZING I'm dreaming about my next visit already. My friend made reservations early around 9:30 pm and we were one of the very first groups to arrive but the place started to fill up pretty quickly.  There was no cover because we visited on a Wednesday.  The band that night was their house band and they were absolutely amazing and so talented.  They were so talented i forgot all about my problems and just enjoyed the very moment. Service for drinks was also great and our waitress was very friendly and helpful.  They do have a 2 drink or 2 item minimum per person and we easily met that minimum as we were there to kick off a fun filled weekend. Highly highly recommend.  Get there early, make reservations and just enjoy the music.  Definitely a MUST visit.

Pros:1. Live band that engages the crowd - they brought people up to the stage (ME, being one haha)2. Seating area available (booths)3. You can order food or drinksCons:1. Cover charge with minimum of 2 drinks2. Very loud - although there are booths as seating areas, you can't really have a conversation with your friends because it's extremely loud3. Waitresses took a very long time to take our orders4. You can't buy from the bar if you have a table - you have to order your drinks through the waitressNote: 1. I went on a Saturday and the band was playing cover songs. Anything from 80s oldies to present day hits. 2. Although the place is very casual, the drinks are somewhat pricey for the amount. I bought 5 tequila shots and paid $10.50 a shot.Tip:1. Reserve a table through the site before you go. You won't get charged extra and you'll definitely get a table. I reserved a table the day of - about three hours before to be exact. It was an easy process, I was with a group of five and as soon as we got there we were seated.

Beware! I was there with my cousin visiting from San Fran for the Saturday 10pm show. The entrance was through the side entrance of the crowded Fat Black Cat bar next door. A big heavy set black man blocking the door told us it was $15 each cash only so we paid him and gave us a seat card. We enjoyed the show and got the 2 drink minimum. When we got the bill at the end of the show we were charged another $15 each on the bill. When I told the waitress that we paid at the door she said that no one collects at the door. She brought the manager over and he said none of their staff would do that and we were scammed by someone at the door pretending they worked there. Go there at your own risk and prepare to be scammed! There's no way good natured guests could anticipated this scam unless they're warned. Best to avoid this place altogether!

5 stars for the music!!! no stars for the staff who are soooooo rude and pretentious.  Expect to be punched in the ribs by the old Lady in the back if you walk the wrong way to the restroom!  Crazy!Bartender is also rude!  What's up with this Nazi- run establishment? And don't be surprised if a bar fight starts between the wait staff!

The female manager with the long brown hair was terrible. Customer service here was the worst I've ever experienced. After they kicked three people out from our table for no reason, they kicked the whole table out. Even though the comedians were the funniest I've ever seen, I will never come back because of that manager. Sorry but they lost 15 customers because of her.

Such a fun night! We came here on a Saturday for a double date. Arrive early! We arrived 15 minutes before the 7:15 show, which ended up being perfect timing as we were seated in an amazing booth in the middle of the room. The room is seated from front to back, so if you enjoy sitting in the front and don't mind being a part of the jokes, come early. Being a student, I'm pretty price conscious and was worried we were going to be spending a ton with the 2 item minimum on top of the $20 cover fee. However, the menu turned out to have a range of options at various price points. The 2 item minimum includes food, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Food ranged from $2.50-$9.50, while drinks ranged from $5.50 (bud lite) to $12 (premium martinis).  Note that the suggested tip on your receipt will be calculated off the total, including the cover charge, but you should only tip for your drinks & food.As for the show, the comedians were great! We were laughing the whole night.  The jokes are very, very non-PC, so just be aware of that.  Service was not great - it was a bit hard to get our waitress's attention.  The alcoholic drinks were mixed - beers were fine, but some of the martinis were quite syrupy and pretty lackluster.  The food was terrible - some of the worst I've had in NYC, or anywhere for that matter.  So try to eat dinner beforehand :)All in all, it's worth going, but only for the comedians.

I came here for a comedy night since the Comedy Cellar expanded into this venue.  My only gripe with this place was the bill.  I find it pretty sleezy of management to include the cover charge along with the food and drinks on one bill... then calculate the suggested tip based on the full total.  Tips are for service, not a cover charge.  Exactly what service did you provide when I paid you to let me in the door?  I know it's just a "suggestion", but management knows full well the psychology of this... and I'm pretty sure they've been enjoying the effective 30-50% tips they've been getting on their food and service now.  I just find this very underhanded.  This place is already one of the most expensive comedy nights out in NYC (at $20 pp + 2 item minimum), so trying to gouge your customers on a tip at the end is just poor form.That aside, the comedy and the atmosphere are great.  Just pay extra attention when the bill comes to your table.  I really hope management corrects this soon.

This place is great. The band is amazing, and it's free to get in on Wednesday, so if you are in the village and want to hear some real awesome covers, go, go down the dark stair case, sit in the faux leather booths, enjoy your obligatory drink (infused berry vodka martini is strong and berrylicious, home made), and groove on. The solos make you wonder how "artists" we hear on the radio make it to our stations but powerful and talented people like them play in a bar. They deserve the fame that comes along the talent they have, and we are all very lucky to see them play live and give all of them to us for a few hours!

My Fiancé and I went here on a Labor Day Monday--BlackVelvetMonday. One of the bartenders at Junior's highly recommended it for my taste of music.I made a reservation 3 hours before--and it stated to arrive at 9:30pm. We did just that, and was one of the first 3 tables to be seated. The band didn't start playing until 10:15ish... So it was quite a wait which was fine.The table sign indicated that there's a two drink minimum, but it's actually a two item minimum-- drink and or food.I ordered the fries-- it looked and tasted like McDonalds fries. And I ordered one chicken Skewer ($2) there were 3 one inch cubed chicken breasts. It was alright, I would definitely suggest eating before coming here.BUT OH MY GOD-- the BAND and MUSIC was amazing. Gave me chills. And they had open mic, so a lot of the talented New Yorkers showed off their talents. I had so much fun!!! It was the cherry on top to the end of my New York Trip.

Really great venue. I saw Colin Quinn, who was very interesting and funny, but also super psychological and historical. He actually expanded my knowledge. Anyway, the venue itself was great - it comes with the usual rude-ish servers that you get at all places with drink minimums, but the service was quick. The place was not too crowded. I will return for sure and certainly recommend to anyone visiting town. Better than Caroline's, in my opinion. Oh and if you are in town for a short while, this place is great and so is the Comedy Cellar and Dangerfields.

I have been to the original comedy cellar previously, so I was apprehensive to go to the comedy cellar at village underground, but still had very high expectations. We could not get reservations and were not called on the stand by list, so we were told we could go to the village underground and get in immediately. We stood in line for 20 min, had Ids checked, moved to the bottom of the stairs, by were not given a card and were sent back up to the beginning of the line after being denied admittance. They then resat us at two tables after we waited in line again. A couple of the comedians were mediocre, however, the headliner was great and made up for all of the annoyances of getting in. The waitstaff is great and works with such efficiency, it would be great if they could get that down on the front end of the place.

I've always been a fan of VU because of their cover band. I was a little sad to see the Then not playing as often and it is more of a comedy show place. I came here last night for the first time to watch a comedy show. Marina (our host) was hilarious and kept the audience going. My favorite comedienne was Greer Barnes. I would definitely come back to see them again. We satin the front row so it was great to see them so close but I think I might sit 1st/2nd row center to get a better view of the facial expressions. I would recommend this place for folks looking for a nice casual night of laughs.

Review is for dancing on Saturday night: (no other reviews were that clear on that)Music was varied--the dj played short sections of many songs in different genres.  Dance floor got super crowded around 12:30 but they kind of let you dance anywhere so you can move a little away and find a good spot.  $10 cover for okay dj seems like a rip-off.  Dj also have a lot of shout-outs which I thought were cheesy.
Awesome place : ) so many talents here, unbelievable. Came on a Monday night, and lots of excitement, thumbs up.Be mindful of the bill, tip is included :)

This place is awesome and definitely top notch. I had an awesome band playing a variety of music and adding their own twist. It was an amazing performance. It was an amazing experience and definitely would come again and would recommend to friend to come.They serve drinks such as beer and wine and cocktails. It was just a great time and you forget what time it is when you are there. I love this place!

Came here last to watch the live band and they really know how to get a crowd going. All the ladies in the joint were admiring and twinkle eyed whenever the electric guitarists had their solo spotlights. The singers of the group had amazing voices and sang a number of covers that had almost everyone in the audience singing along. Toward the end of the night, the dance floor was filled with people having a good time. We didn't have to pay cover on a Thursday night. Also - they group smaller parties together at tables so be prepared to socialize and meet a couple new friends.Only thing I disliked - it was a bit too loud. so if you're planning this for a first date, the only thing you'll know better about your date is if they have any dance moves.
Iconic spot to see live unsigned talent. Not an amateur open mic. You've been warned...lol The food is horrendous though. Typical fried bar stuff. Only go there for the talent and drinks.

Damn, this place is cool. It's like that cool kid in high school that had all the right style and knew all the up-and-coming music. Natural flair. That's the Village Underground.My friends were looking to find a bar/dance club with fairly reasonable prices in the village last weekend. With the help of my Yelp Community, I found this place. The line wasn't too long out the door, but the place looked bumpin'. In case you didn't know the Village Underground is connected to the Fat Black Pussycat. The FBP is a lounge (free of charge) but the VU you have to pay $15 to get in. Not rediculously pricey, considering you can go to both locations. Okay I have to admit, I am a NYC nightlife newbie. Ask me of some good places on LI and I'll drop some names, but Manhattan is a different story. So bare with me here peeps.When walking in, I saw a wall of celebrity pictures from Ray Romano to Derek Jeter. So I thought to myself, hey this place must be good. We all headed straight downstairs and BAM. I heard the smoothest, funkiest, soulful music I've ever heard in my life. People were dancing and jamming to the live band. It's actually not that big downstairs. I would say it's split into two... half seating, half dancefloor and stage. The band that was playing, I wish I remembered their name however, I will not forget their sound. There was a man and woman singing along with the sickest guitar player. I mean that guy had SKILLS. Those rifts and those vocals, wowza.The only thing I wish differently about this place was the size of the dancefloor. People were having fun but it was person against person, (not my fav.) The live band switched on and off with the DJ who played everything from rachet to pop to hip hop. And a little bit of old school (well old school for me). Drinks are of course pricey... $12 for a whiskey ginger or a jack and coke. But trust me, they're not watered down in the slightest. If you want to try something new and a positive change of scene, I would HIGHLY recommend this place. Give it a shot and feel the music, I had a blast and hope you do too.

Solid five stars for the comedy show, but 1 star for the RAW FOOD I was served. The dim lighting, set up and size of the place makes for an enjoyable atmosphere. Arriving just before the 8:30p show without any reservations, we were accomodated without a problem.  We were seated at a booth in the back where they sat 6 people per table. This was a little cramped and I suggest installing bag hooks underneath the tables to maximize seating space. But I get it, these comedy undergrounds are often closterphobic, so this wasn't surprising at all. The comedians here were great and it was truly one of the most enjoyable shows I've seen in the city for the price. However, I have one substantial complaint: DO NOT ORDER THE CHICKEN SKEWERS. Everything was going well until I bit into severely undercooked chicken skewers. For $2 per skewer, I ordered two of these chicken skewers. Wary of the unusually tender meat I had bit into (for chicken), I cut open the next chunk. To my horror, the chicken in the middle was straight up raw, not pink, RAW. UNCOOKED. I immediately notified our waitress who apologized profusely. Since we were in the middle of a comedy act, I didn't want to make a big deal it. Can you imagine if I had eaten two skewers full of raw chicken? Thank god I only ate one piece and didn't end up sick.

Went with a group of friends after booking a 8pm show on a Wednesday night on Comedy Cellar. Seemed like Comedy Cellar has expanded to this location. It was so packed for a Wednesday night! Great energy, good mix, every single comic was really great and the lineup was impressive with people like Friedlander. Has a great time. The food options were actually better than expected and included sliders, fries, little burgers and the like.

. Old school in every respect. Fantastic musical acts all the time. Catch Cubensis there for a real treat. Friendly staff, fairly priced generous drinks. This is one bar that you can go to alone and not feel alone
Love this comedy club. Comedians are always hilarious and the price is reasonable.

Go on Monday's. Just go on Monday's. the place has great talent and its a good place to just listen to music and be upbeat. Later in the night they had other performers who could be hit or miss but they are usually hits.Highly recommend this place when you want a more interesting Monday night.
Like this place!Great vibe Great band Can move a little bit by the music :)Come and enjoy!

One of my favorite places to pregame. It has live entertainment including Amina from Love and Hip Hop. The crowd is mixed in age. It has plenty of seating and a medium sized dance floor. The drinks are average price for the city.

There is a cover charge to get into the downstairs Live-Band area. After being invited in we got to experience it and very much enjoyed ourselves. For it being a Friday night, with a live band, and a birthday celebration going on, the place was pretty calm and not crowded at all. Not sure if it was the venue or the company but we had fun dancing the night away. Dancing is after all one of the best ways to unwind!! The live band playing that night was really good, composed of one d*uchy Im too cool to acknowledge you lesser beings - guitar player but the other band members were celebrity-esk cool! There were plenty of seats, dancing area was narrow but then again not many people were dancing so it was perfect.

Loved this place for years!! Best place in the city for live music with some of the most talented musicians. What I am upset about tho is that they no longer have live music Friday or Saturday night what the hell?!?!?! I was so shocked and upset just now me and my boyfriend have been coming here for a random date night on the weekend for years, now tonight we hear that it's comedy only on the weekend this sucks

I've been coming here for every. I can not believe there not going to be no more open mic.  I would have never ever thought this would happen.  This was the best place in nyc for good music. Where do I go now. The Groove!!! It's the same. But not the same.

When you want great live music...Im talking about hearing great Chaka, some Stevie, Lenny K, Nirvana, and even a lil of MJB. This is the place to be on a Friday night. The house band is one of my favs..They can do any and every thing! You might run into a few celebs who just want to to hear other musicians or join the jam session. I went one Friday night and John Mayer just walked and joined the band......HOTTTTTT!! On Sunday & Monday nights it's open mic night. Sundays are with Ron Grant, and Mondays are w/ R&B Great Vocal powerhouse Cheryl Pepsi Riley. Don't fret you wont just hear someone who definitely sounds a mess. You will definitely be treated to some of the best musicians NYC has to offer. One complaint: Service is not the greatest, I'm talking about a waitress disappearing for like an 1hr. But it can't keep me away I love music and understand that some people just really hate their job...LOL! You will not be disappointed... You'll probably even see me there singing my heart out!!!

This is an older review, but a well worth one. Came here many many years ago roughly in 2005 to 2010 time frame. I came here by mistake the first time because I thought it was the FBPC room that was new. But I found out it wasnt and it was something different. Of course I was reluctant to pay 10 bucks to enter a bar or so I thought it was just a bar. What I found was something better. Music loud and enjoyable. Crowded but had a blast. Came here again for a friends bday and we just turned up til 4am. One of the better secrets of NYC.  And I put that its not good for dancing because they way the location is set up, it provided little wiggle room to move. But an overall enjoyable place.

Randomly stumbled in here after dinner at Minetta Tavern and discovered one of the best live bands I have ever seen! Sounds like from other reviews that this place is known for its live performances, and in a city like NYC where there are so many aspiring artists, it makes sense that every night has something special. Definitely come check this place out - you never know what amazing talent you'll get to see.

It's an awesome place to catch some stand up comedy. Although you will need to put your name on the list coz this place is packed on weekends. But if you're lucky to have a good roaster for the night, you'd be sorted. No idea how the food is, the beers worked for us!

Don't waste your money on other no-name comedy clubs nearby and just go to Comedy Cellar (both locations).  The crowd, energy, and the line-up is far better at The Comedy Cellar and The Village Underground than other places.

I always seem to have to book Comedy Cellar a week in advance, but Village Underground you can sometimes get away with a day. Most of the time, they seem to get all of the same acts, but are more spacious and relaxed. In some ways, I think I might even like this better than Comedy Cellar! Great spot. Never been disappointed.

We went there for a birthday and it was an awesome experience! It was on a Monday so they had an open mic night and we got to see some awesome lover performances and the bday boy got to get up a do his thing! It was definitely a night to remember!

Love, love, love this place!I've been meaning to get here for months now. I love live music and when I moved to the city almost a year ago now I scouted Yelp and asked friends for recommendations on places to go, and this was top on my list. I went on a Friday night with a friend and had a blast! I made reservations online which I guess helps guarantee you a seat, although based on advice from other Yelpers my friend and I arrived about 20 minutes before the 10:00 show. We were seated in comfy booths in front of the stage but spent time alternating between singing along with the band, grooving in our seats and dancing on the floor in front of the stage. The energy was so live and everyone seemed to be having a good time!The musicians were entertaining not only with their songs, but also with the jokes and comments they'd make between songs. In the middle of the band's set the DJ played popular songs and kept the crowd up and dancing. I will definitely be back!Pros:1. Prime location off the train W 4th st2. Great /energy/ambiance3. Talented performers3. Laid back/not pretentious vibeCons:1. None

Went here last night for the other comedy cellar location (10pm show), its a bigger space then comedy cellar. I book reservations online 2 hours before, it was $14/pp plus 2 drink minimum. I had been drinking earlier and had work the next day, so I pretty much ordered bottled water and a beer. If you don't meet your minimum 2 item requirement/pp, they will pretty much as you to. Otherwise the lineup was solid, they had a live band, I would definitely go back. If you don't like your seat, you pretty much have to go upstairs and get a reassignment.

I had such a disappointing night here for the Comedy Cellar. The comedians and musicians were great, but the staff overshadowed what would have otherwise been an enjoyable night. It was my friend's birthday and she took out her phone to coordinate plans with other friends. Granted, phones are - apparently strictly - not allowed, but instead of politely asking her to put her phone away, the staff harassed her during and after the show and made her feel horrible. She offered to let them see her phone to show she hadn't taken any photos or videos and they said "I don't need to see your phone." It was just a power trip. I don't ever post reviews, but when people ruin my friend's birthday, my protective side comes out. If you love your friends, don't bring them here!

We went to this place because I wanted to have fun and listen to good music, the place was dark, very very cold and had a funny smell. the band was very good, to cover other, but still worth listening to. the problem was that offered the last call, so we bought the last beer, when we had not been even half comes the guard and take us, I thought I could keep taking my stop beer near the door, why do we sell a drink if we could not take it?, then returned the guard to us (women) and aceran to us that we have to go and telling us we were stupid and did not understand, English is not our first language, but that does not mean that we understood that we were trying very bad, I never go to that place again until he leaves and already told all my friends what happened to us. PS: we have to leave the beer there because of the aggressiveness of a very tall and big guard against two women was too much

Every time I visit NYC, i always make sure to spend at least one evening here.   The live music is ALWAYS outstanding, and great small venue in this basement club.   Very friendly and fun atmosphere.   Some nights there is a small cover charge.   On nights when no cover, there is a 2 drink minimum, but well worth it to enjoy the show.

Visited NYC (8/1/14) and was invited out for the live music.  I wasn't sure what to expect, but I had a great time!! The band sung various genres, so there is definitely something for everyone.Guests should definitely arrive early. A friend  booked a big table to accommodate our large group, so that was a plus! The drinks were blah and I was disappointed that we were made to purchase 2 drinks per person.  I refused to pay over $10 for another cocktail, so I went for the water. $4 for a 16oz bottle  Also, bring cash!!! We were told that we could only use 3 cards per table
I believe they can do much better comedians. I have been to many comedy stand up and by far worst night. I would not pay for this or recommend it to any one

It is the other half of the Fat Black Pussy Cat and it is located downstairs. Mostly the place has a live band playing here most of the times. They have a resonable cover charge of ten bucks most of the time.Went here a couple of times when the live band was playing. The bouncers and the staff downstairs are helpful. The live band though was not very good every time I came here with my friends.

We went there for a comedy show, five comedian performed and all of them were funny (although i didn't get the jokes from one of them, probably because Of my young age and not being from here).We had two order two items per person!The variety of drinks specially beers was terrible! IF IT WASN'T for comedians i would have given a two star for the service and variety of drinks!

Couldn't have asked for a better night! I had read reviews but still had no idea how much fun was to be had. Sat at a booth right In front of the stage with another great couple and started our night with great drinks! I drank the Devils Road (I think that's it) delicious!! And my friend had a Fire Island Iced tea, very sweet. Both served in martini glasses. And then the band started! Absolutely fantastic music selections, old and new! Show started at 1015 and within half an hour people were dancing... And it never stopped!! All ages, all ethnicities, suit jackets and jeans! So. Much. Fun!! Can't wait to go back!! 2 drink minimum, 10-15 dollar cover

It's pretty crazy when you can say the BOUNCERS are much nicer than the staff at a club/lounge in NY. I have to give this place one star for the unprofessional treatment I received this past weekend. My sisters were visiting and requested I take them to a lounge and I figured they'd love the Village Underground. This place was packed to the gills which is usual and if you like constantly being pushed up against and crushed then this place is for you. If you'd like a place to sit and actually enjoy the place, you got to come early. I get that I get that. . We paid $15 and went downstairs to find there was NO WHERE to sit. While we stood there looking stupid the staff ignored us and we were again being pushed up against and molested by the foot traffic. We thought there was a vacant table and as we sat down and were prepared to order, you know SPEND SOME SERIOUS CASH we were rudely told that the table was reserved. Of course, there was no sign or anything on the table so I guess we were supposed to telepathically know that.  Confused I try to ask around for how to get a table but the staff was again unhelpful and after taking our entry fee money obviously didn't care. After standing around and being asked to move out of the way by another rude staff member (Move where!!?) I was annoyed, angry and over it. My sisters tried to enjoy themselves but a look at the compacted orgy fest of people dancing up on the stage wasn't our cup of tea.  We took our money and our good vibes to Iguanas which is FREE by the way.

I cant give this place anything lower than 5 stars being that I'm here almost every week. I used to go Wednesday for the band, which is fantastic. Now I come on sundays for the open mic and cant believe the talent that goes up there! I thought these people had to audition to perform at the Village Underground but one of the singers told me he just had to sign up. Its a mix of showtime at the Apollo meets the voice, except I swear the singers are some of the best i've ever heard.  Many times the singers are repeat performers which is great because it would be a pity to only see some of these performers sing only once. I'm Going again tonight and bringing my family, last week I  brought friends. To the review saying something about not being able to find a seat, it should be said that you get to see what the venue looks like before you decide to pay the entrance fee. So if it looks too crowded you get the option of walking out before paying or sucking it up and standing. Its worth it for me either way.

Amazing drinks! Great performance from all the artists! Would definitely recommend for a date night or even when you would like to lough and relax... Don't ask for a front raw table if you can't handle it... Amazing experience love it!!!
Very cool vibes in this place! Love to come there with bunch of people, its always a great music and cool crowd

We called and they said there was no cover. There was, so we went upstairs to the Fat Black Cat or something. My friends and I sat at the bar, it wasn't close to close or anything but the bartender very rudely pressured my friends to order at least one drink if sitting at the bar. What if my friend was sober? Also important to mention there were PLENTY of open bar seats. The place was dead to begin with. I had ordered one drink but we were so insulted at his insisting that they pick something or leave that we left.

This place rox!  They have great DJs and awesome live music.  Sometimes people just show up and end up performing.  It's located downstairs from The Fat Black Pussy Cat, another Village staple, and the vibe is always chill.  The crowd is friendly and it gets pack on the weekends, Thur-Sun.  It is definitely worth it to check it out at least once during the week and once on the weekend and I promise you, you will want to come back. Mon-Thurs has free admission and you don't know who you might see...

A special friend took me to this location.  FANTASTIC!   The live band was outstanding. I had a great time. The crowd was live and the band played from pop to reggae.  I strongly recommend this underground spot. There is also karaoke on the upper level.  Lots of space.  Open till 4am. That's what's up.

I came here with a group of people last Saturday night.  I have to admit that seeing live bands and dancing isn't my thing (I'm much more of a dive bar guy), so I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of fun I had dancing to a band that seemed to know exactly what I wanted to listen to.  The beers weren't too expensive (about $7), which helped fuel some of the fun as well.It was $12 to get into seeing the band -- it was totally worth it.  Honestly, I don't know how often I would go to this place, but I wish I had discovered it earlier during my time in New York.

Went last night for their legendary open Mic night. First thing MAKE RESERVATIONS! I had reservations but tried to bring extra and the guy at the front was a total jerk about letting them in with us. Ended up speaking to someone over him and getting them in with no issues.  If you don't bring enough people to fill up a both or table you will be sharing with a random couple or group.Its open Mic night so anyone can hop on stage. its hit or miss. There was a washed up singers collective there so we had to site though all 5 of them performing individuals but as back up to one another. I was ver that after their 3rd person. There were a few great performers as well as the host is amazing. I'd go for the host.Food was ehhhh. Considering theres a $15 dollar cover Id like more generous drink and food portions and options. I had the Calamari which was okay, not the best. My boyfriend had the Fire Island martini which was delicious, I'd order that again. Will be back just not sure when.

This place is a gem . The live music is awesome . The cover band really puts on a good show . There's a cover charge but it's worth it . The line isn't too bad . The food /drinks are very basic .  Come here with 2 or 10 you're bound to have a great time .

Wow!  What a fun night!  Dancing and singing until 3 in the morning!I was visiting New York for my sisters wedding shower and afterwards a few girls wanted to go out for the night.  We found Village Underground and got there around 930, pretty early.  (15 dollars at the door)  We got a table which had a two drink minimum to sit, which seemed great to me!  Had a waiter bring us drinks all night!  The band was AWESOME!  Great live music, sang lots of hits, oldies, and songs you just love!  By 1130 the place was packed and everyone was out of their seats dancing!  It was a great night!

So I've been here a few times and each time it's been a pleasurable experience.I usually go on open mic night (I guess that's what they call) when Cheryl Pepsii Riley host. She's very entertaining and keeps the show running smoothly.This is the perfect spot for date night, girls night out, poetry junkies (like myself) and live band fanatics.If you can't attend the show, they have live web viewings (yesssss, now I can watch Monday night open mics while in my pjs!)The drinks are OK, nothing special.The atmosphere is very laid back and trendy.Parking sucks unless you park in one of the parking garages or just practice patience (not gonna happen!) and wait for someone to move their car.Overall: Cool spot, will return soon!

Visiting from California and ran into a guy in Time Sq selling Comedy Show tix.  He recommended this spot since I was looking for a place that plays hip hop.  I dont usually like going to clubs with a live band but this spot completely changed my perspective.  The band was on point and kept the everyone up and dancing all night.  Next time in in NY, I'm definitely going to head back here.

I was here for a friend's birthday last night and had a blast! A bit skeptical about paying a $10 cover on a Friday night but it was worth every penny.  Amanda Brown  blew up the stage (YouTube her, she was on the show The Voice) as did the other singers.  During the moments when the band was on a break, the music was really a nice mixture of 90's, R&B, and pop.  Also, the crowd was so diverse! It was the epitome of what it means to be in New York City: combining people of all ages and races to enjoy phenomenal live music.  Don't hesitate to come.

On Saturday Night our party of four went to the Village underground to catch the comedy--- and they delivered!!!!  Almost al of the comedians were from some TV show you've heard of and they were fhilarious!  I can't remember the last time I cried while laughing so hard. Two drink minimum and $20 for the show and it was all worth it for a really funny time out on a perfect spring night in the village. I'd recommend it highly and will be back myself for more soon.

Every second Tuesday (of the month) is Funk Nite! Get yer funk on! I paid the cover, but managed to avoid the minimum by becoming friends with the band. It was great too because although I was kicked out of a funk band that rehearses on Saturdays, I'm coming back to jam with these guys next month. Revenge is sweet.

I LOVE This place!!It is great for a group of friends. I am not the clubbing type, but I love lounges and live music- this is the perfect in between.They have booths that face the stage. You can order a drink and some bar food and relax and enjoy the show, or get up and dance to your favorite tune.Cost: I usually go on Friday's which is $10 to get in and two drink minimum. Some may say its pretty steep, but once the music is going you'll forget all about it. Drinks/Food:The drinks are great. Try their signature martinis (only two allowed). My friend and I tried three one night and seen why they only allow two. The food is regular bar food which is OK.Band: DOPE DOPE DOPE. Amanda from the Voice performs with the band and she Killlllssss it honey chall. Cheryl Pepsi Riley comes to sing from time and to time and kills it as well. Really all the band members do their part to put on a great show. Sometimes their version of a song is better than the original! I have been here a lot and I have seen everyone from Wycleff and John Mayer come to rock out with the band. The only thing I find annoying is the reservations. if your doing it online, make sure to call and confirm. There were times I come with a group and they don't have my information and I have to sit in nose bleeds land (and that's no fun). P.S. if you get tired of the band, head right upstairs to Fat Black Pussycat. They have great music and nice decor.

Food is meh and the prices are a bit high, but the live music more than makes up for it! Please check this place out if your a fan of new and old school. The performers are great and the servers are always friendly. Near top marks.

I went on Sunday a few weeks back and I must say this place was great. My wife and I were able to get a corner lounge seat to the left of the stage and it was perfect. The host was funny and entertaining. It was my wife's birthday and he sung happy birthday to her... That was really special. The band and talent was amazing! Music from the 90s and back. The only bad thing about that night was hearing the Sunday show will not be there for very long. So i am planning to go back soon before they move. Overall this place is excellent and is the perfect spot for dates, birthdays, or just a night on the town.

I came here with my boyfriend for my 22nd birthday, and had some good laughs!My issues were...1. We had a reservation, and showed up literally 2 minutes late and had to wait in line to 'see if they had space left.' -_- Um, it's not that serious, but I mean we got in less than 15 minutes afterwards which is what matters, but did not like that I was told I had to wait without knowing if they would have enough space. If you come here make sure to arrive EARLY! They recommend 15 minutes. 2. Due to our "lateness" we got sat all the way in back in these super long booths that we had to share with two other parties, which I suppose is our fault for not arriving early, but just definitely not a fan of the whole set up. I can understand them trying to make the most of their space, but I did not enjoy having to share the seating, it was awkward, and tight, and had to yell over the other people for my waitress to hear what I wanted to order. 3. Service was not great, but the place was so packed I guess I can understand it, it took my waitress to walk by at least 6 times before she noticed that I was trying to get her attention. Which could also be because we were sat all the way against the wall.4. We decided to order their pitcher of sangria, which was listed on the menu for 8 people lol. My boyfriend and I had about 4 cups each, and just barely got a buzz on. Welp. LONG STORY SHORT: If you come out for their comedy show make sure to come early so you don't get shitty seating, or shitty service. And if you get the sangria, definitely ask them to make it strong! Other than that, you're in for some good laughs!

This place was amazing, and my friends and I had so much fun! The house band is to die for---truly an amazing and talented group that will entertain you and make you dance all night long! They play all different types of music, but a lot of dance numbers, but the place often times gets really packed and then, there's not a lot of room to dance. But nevertheless, I'm definitely coming back here!!!

Average drinks, but really entertaining performers. Their main lounge is very crowded, with a 2-drinks minimum per person requirement to get a table. They also have a downstairs section that acts as the dance floor. It had a $15 cover, and was absolutely poppin'. My night was a blur, so I can't offer too many useful comments, but the live music was extremely fun. The lead singer, with his 2 backup singers/dancers, really got everyone involved. While I may not remember much, I know I had a great, fun-filled night.

This place is always great I love open mic night. Honestly i wish they had more seating because it can get really crowded down there. The cover charge to get into the downstairs Live-Band area sometimes changes.

Went here on a Saturday night with my 2 sisters. We went downstairs to hear the live band, Rahj & Mash. The music was great! It was a full house so we danced in place most of the night but no one minded and almost everyone did the same. I will say if you want to have a conversation with anyone, the music is VERY loud, so prepare to dance but not speak. Also, it takes a while to get drinks at the bar.If you're lucky (which we weren't) you may have a Prince and his entourage sighting. He is known to frequent this nightclub.

I went here last night to celebrate with a friend. This is the most amazing thing I've ever seen. It was like one huge jam session but we just happened to be watching. The chemistry, the energy and the skill on that stage was amazing. Even when the band took a break the DJ was awesome.

Great music, great ambiance. Can get crowded and dance floor is kind of cozy. $15 cover charge to get in.Mimosa was $15, but they used the good champagne so it tasted amazing and to me that's worth it!Live band was terrific.If you want a fun night out, don't mind being pushed up against people or run over by full figured women and drunk boys, you can have a lot of fun here!Would go back again!

I had the time of my life here Thursday night. Why? Oh, I dont know. Maybe it was the live band, the drinks, hmm, the whole vibe? Yeah. I loved the house band and all the songs they covered. I'm usually the awkward, shy person at shows like these, sitting down and just sipping my drink. However, this place and the band had me bopping my head and moving up and down my seat. This is THE place to go if you feel like dancing up a storm and singing along to covers of Prince, Lauryn Hill, and so forth.There is a two drink minimum! That may not attract those looking to save money since drinks are pricey, but having seen the martini selection I think I had about three or four.

Great place to have fun with friends and live music.  Cover bands did a great job keeping the crowd entertained!  At least on the night I went it was a mix of Hip Hop, R&B, and some classic 80's music.  Talented group of performers!Only thing I would say is that the place gets extremely crowded and it's not exactly a huge place to begin with.  Music was at times a little too loud to the point you'd have to use sign language or morse code to communicate with your friend sitting a foot away from you.  Regardless, I had a great time here!

YES amazing wings like everyone says. I took a friend and we were in LOVE The band works so well together people change in and out, its great everyone is on such a cool vibe what a relief. LOVE the music you. On this night we were graced by Chrisette Michelle who BLEW it up. I remember pinching myself like am I really here, me and my friend looked at each other like OMG for 10.00 worth every minute of it. Monifah was there too she was so great and amazing to see how laid back they were.
